chapter.title: Knowledge Manager Features
chapter.para: Knowledge's application administrator has access to features in order to manage projects, permissions, and users. Most of these workflows are viewable in a separate section of the application called Knowledge Manager. Editors and content managers have permissions to the section called Knowledge Editor.

section.title: Getting Started as a Knowledge Administrator
section.para: As an application administrator, you have permissions to view and edit workflows in the Manager area of the application. This area typically houses information that affects all project areas and users under the application environment. If you are not already in Manager, you can navigate to the area by selecting the "Manager" option in the navigation menu. The information in this section will provide an overview of the display layouts and set-up information.

section.title: Adding New Users
section.para: To add a user, select the "Accounts and Roles" option in the main navigation. On this page, there should be a table that lists all users in the application along with filter options to aide in user search. Select the "New Account" button on this page.

On the Create a New Account page, fill in the appropriate information. Select the permissions that the user will have for ALL projects assigned, this is described as Global in the application. Project-specific permissions can be assigned on the Edit Account Profile page after the account is created.

In order for the new user to access the project contents, the account must be assigned the appropriate projects and roles, so after account creation, select the user from the View Accounts and Roles page. You can assign the requested projects to the user under the "Assign to Project" dropdown. Select "Add" to confirm the assignment.

To modify roles and permissions per project, select "Edit Roles" for the specific project on the Edit Account Profile page. There, you can assign additional permissions to the user if different projects require different access levels.
